00040 struct CV
00041 {
00042     std::string URI;
00043     std::string cvLabel;
00044     std::string fullName;
00045     std::string version;
00046 
00047     bool empty() const;
00048 };

00050 
00051 struct UserParam
00052 {
00053     std::string name;
00054     std::string value;
00055     std::string type;
00056 
00057     UserParam(const std::string& _name = "", 
00058               const std::string& _value = "", 
00059               const std::string& _type = "");
00060 
00061     /// templated value access with type conversion
00062     template<typename value_type>
00063     value_type valueAs() const
00064     {
00065         return !value.empty() ? boost::lexical_cast<value_type>(value) 
00066                               : boost::lexical_cast<value_type>(0);
00067     } 
00068 
00069     bool empty() const;
00070     bool operator==(const UserParam& that) const;
00071     bool operator!=(const UserParam& that) const;
00072 };
00073 
00074 
00075 /// special case for bool (outside the class for gcc 3.4, and inline for msvc)
00076 template<>
00077 inline bool UserParam::valueAs<bool>() const
00078 {
00079     return value == "true";
00080 }

00083 struct ParamGroup;
00084 typedef boost::shared_ptr<ParamGroup> ParamGroupPtr;
00085 
00086 
00087 struct ParamContainer
00088 {
00089     std::vector<ParamGroupPtr> paramGroupPtrs;
00090     std::vector<CVParam> cvParams;
00091     std::vector<UserParam> userParams;
00092     
00093     /// Finds cvid in the container:
00094     /// - returns first CVParam result such that (result.cvid == cvid); 
00095     /// - if not found, returns CVParam(CVID_Unknown)
00096     /// - recursive: looks into paramGroupPtrs
00097     CVParam cvParam(CVID cvid) const; 
00098 
00099     /// Finds child of cvid in the container:
00100     /// - returns first CVParam result such that (result.cvid is_a cvid); 
00101     /// - if not found, CVParam(CVID_Unknown)
00102     /// - recursive: looks into paramGroupPtrs
00103     CVParam cvParamChild(CVID cvid) const; 
00104 
00105     /// returns true iff cvParams contains exact cvid (recursive)
00106     bool hasCVParam(CVID cvid) const;
00107 
00108     /// returns true iff cvParams contains a child (is_a) of cvid (recursive)
00109     bool hasCVParamChild(CVID cvid) const;
00110 
00111     /// Finds UserParam with specified name 
00112     /// - returns UserParam() if name not found 
00113     /// - not recursive: looks only at local userParams
00114     UserParam userParam(const std::string&) const; 
00115 
00116     /// set/add a CVParam (not recursive)
00117     void set(CVID cvid, const std::string& value = "", CVID units = CVID_Unknown);
00118 
00119     /// set/add a CVParam (not recursive)
00120     template <typename value_type>
00121     void set(CVID cvid, value_type value, CVID units = CVID_Unknown)
00122     {
00123         set(cvid, boost::lexical_cast<std::string>(value), units);
00124     }
00125 
00126     bool empty() const;
00127 };
00128 
00129 
00130 /// special case for bool (outside the class for gcc 3.4, and inline for msvc)
00131 template<>
00132 inline void ParamContainer::set<bool>(CVID cvid, bool value, CVID units)
00133 {
00134     set(cvid, (value ? "true" : "false"), units);
00135 }

00402 struct Spectrum : public SpectrumIdentity, public ParamContainer

00413

00415     void getMZIntensityPairs(std::vector<MZIntensityPair>& output) const;
00416 
00417     /// copy binary data arrays into m/z-intensity pair array
00418     /// note: this overload is to allow client to allocate own buffer; the client
00419     /// must determine the correct size beforehand, or an exception will be thrown
00420     void getMZIntensityPairs(MZIntensityPair* output, size_t expectedSize) const;
00421 
00422     /// set binary data arrays 
00423     void setMZIntensityPairs(const std::vector<MZIntensityPair>& input);
00424 
00425     /// set binary data arrays 
00426     void setMZIntensityPairs(const MZIntensityPair* input, size_t size);
00427 };

00460 
00461 
00462 /// 
00463 /// Interface for accessing spectra, which may be stored in memory
00464 /// or backed by a data file (RAW, mzXML, mzML).  
00465 ///
00466 /// Implementation notes:
00467 ///
00468 /// - Implementations are expected to keep a spectrum index in the form of
00469 ///   vector<SpectrumIdentity> or equivalent.  The default find*() functions search
00470 ///   the index linearly.  Implementations may provide constant time indexing.
00471 ///
00472 /// - The semantics of spectrum() may vary slightly with implementation.  In particular,
00473 ///   a SpectrumList implementation that is backed by a file may choose either to cache 
00474 ///   or discard the SpectrumPtrs for future access, with the caveat that the client 
00475 ///   may write to the underlying data.
00476 ///
00477 /// - It is the implementation's responsibility to return a valid SpectrumPtr from spectrum().
00478 ///   If this cannot be done, an exception must be thrown. 
00479 /// 
00480 /// - The 'getBinaryData' flag is a hint if false : implementations may provide valid 
00481 ///   BinaryDataArrayPtrs on spectrum(index, false);  implementations *must* provide 
00482 ///   valid BinaryDataArrayPtrs on spectrum(index, true).
00483 ///
00484 class SpectrumList
00485 {
00486     public:
00487     
00488     /// returns the number of spectra
00489     virtual size_t size() const = 0;
00490 
00491     /// returns true iff (size() == 0)
00492     bool empty() const;
00493 
00494     /// access to a spectrum index
00495     virtual const SpectrumIdentity& spectrumIdentity(size_t index) const = 0;
00496 
00497     /// find id in the spectrum index (returns size() on failure)
00498     virtual size_t find(const std::string& id) const;
00499 
00500     /// find nativeID in the spectrum index (returns size() on failure)
00501     virtual size_t findNative(const std::string& nativeID) const;
00502 
00503     /// retrieve a spectrum by index
00504     /// - binary data arrays will be provided if (getBinaryData == true);
00505     /// - client may assume the underlying Spectrum* is valid 
00506     virtual SpectrumPtr spectrum(size_t index, bool getBinaryData = false) const = 0;
00507 
00508     virtual ~SpectrumList(){} 
00509 };
00510 
00511 
00512 typedef boost::shared_ptr<SpectrumList> SpectrumListPtr;
00513 
00514 
00515 /// Simple writeable in-memory implementation of SpectrumList.
00516 /// Note:  This spectrum() implementation returns internal SpectrumPtrs.
00517 struct SpectrumListSimple : public SpectrumList
00518 {
00519     std::vector<SpectrumPtr> spectra;
00520 
00521     // SpectrumList implementation
00522 
00523     virtual size_t size() const {return spectra.size();}
00524     virtual bool empty() const {return spectra.empty();}
00525     virtual const SpectrumIdentity& spectrumIdentity(size_t index) const;
00526     virtual SpectrumPtr spectrum(size_t index, bool getBinaryData) const;
00527 };
00528 
00529 
00530 typedef boost::shared_ptr<SpectrumListSimple> SpectrumListSimplePtr;
00531

00533 class ChromatogramList
00534 {
00535     public:
00536     
00537     /// returns the number of chromatograms 
00538     virtual size_t size() const = 0;
00539 
00540     /// returns true iff (size() == 0)
00541     bool empty() const;
00542 
00543     /// access to a chromatogram index
00544     virtual const ChromatogramIdentity& chromatogramIdentity(size_t index) const = 0;
00545 
00546     /// find id in the chromatogram index (returns size() on failure)
00547     virtual size_t find(const std::string& id) const;
00548 
00549     /// find nativeID in the chromatogram index (returns size() on failure)
00550     virtual size_t findNative(const std::string& nativeID) const;
00551 
00552     /// retrieve a chromatogram by index
00553     /// - binary data arrays will be provided if (getBinaryData == true);
00554     /// - client may assume the underlying Chromatogram* is valid 
00555     virtual ChromatogramPtr chromatogram(size_t index, bool getBinaryData = false) const = 0;
00556 
00557     virtual ~ChromatogramList(){} 
00558 };

00561 typedef boost::shared_ptr<ChromatogramList> ChromatogramListPtr;

00563 
00564 /// Simple writeable in-memory implementation of ChromatogramList.
00565 /// Note:  This chromatogram() implementation returns internal ChromatogramPtrs.
00566 struct ChromatogramListSimple : public ChromatogramList
00567 {
00568     std::vector<ChromatogramPtr> chromatograms;
00569 
00570     // ChromatogramList implementation
00571 
00572     virtual size_t size() const {return chromatograms.size();}
00573     virtual bool empty() const {return chromatograms.empty();}
00574     virtual const ChromatogramIdentity& chromatogramIdentity(size_t index) const;
00575     virtual ChromatogramPtr chromatogram(size_t index, bool getBinaryData) const;
00576 };

00582 struct Run : public ParamContainer
00583 {
00584     std::string id;
00585     InstrumentPtr instrumentPtr;
00586     SamplePtr samplePtr;
00587     std::string startTimeStamp;
00588     std::vector<SourceFilePtr> sourceFilePtrs;
00589     SpectrumListPtr spectrumListPtr;
00590     ChromatogramListPtr chromatogramListPtr;
00591 
00592     Run(){}
00593     bool empty() const;
00594 
00595     private:
00596     // no copying - any implementation must handle:
00597     // - SpectrumList cloning
00598     // - internal cross-references to heap-allocated objects 
00599     Run(const Run&);
00600     Run& operator=(const Run&);
00601 };

00604 struct MSData
00605 {
00606     std::string accession;
00607     std::string id;
00608     std::string version;
00609     std::vector<CV> cvs; 
00610     FileDescription fileDescription;
00611     std::vector<ParamGroupPtr> paramGroupPtrs;
00612     std::vector<SamplePtr> samplePtrs;
00613     std::vector<InstrumentPtr> instrumentPtrs;
00614     std::vector<SoftwarePtr> softwarePtrs;
00615     std::vector<DataProcessingPtr> dataProcessingPtrs;
00616     Run run;
00617 
00618     MSData(){}
00619     bool empty() const;
00620 
00621     private:
00622     // no copying
00623     MSData(const MSData&);
00624     MSData& operator=(const MSData&);
00625 };
